tit.cmt: 京阪のウェブではハイフンなしの表記でしたので、そのようにいたしました。

sen.j: 鳥羽街道駅（とばかいどうえき）は、京都府京都市東山区福稲下高松町にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Toba-kaido Station (Toba-kaido-eki), located in Shimo-Takamatsu-cho, Fukuine, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 京阪電気鉄道→Keihan Electric Railway [http://www.keihan.co.jp/]
sen.e: Toba-kaido Station (Toba-kaido-eki), located in Shimo-Takamatsu-cho, Fukuine, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility on the Keihan Main Line of the Keihan Electric Railway.
Tobakaido Station, located in Shimo-Takamatsu-cho, Fukuine, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility on the Keihan Main Line of the Keihan Electric Railway.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地平駅。
sen.e: It is a ground station equipped with opposite platforms with two sides and two tracks.
sen.cmt: 相対式ホーム→opposite platforms [鉄道技術用語辞典 online: http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]
sen.e: It's a ground station equipped with opposing two-sided platforms, and each platform serves two tracks.
This station is located on the ground level, with two platforms serving two tracks between them.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 駅舎は出町柳方面行ホーム淀屋橋寄りに設けられており、淀屋橋方面行ホームへは地下道で連絡している。
sen.e: Station building is constructed near the platform for Demachiyanagi Station on the side toward Yodoyabashi Station, and is connected with the platform for Yodoyabashi by an underground passage.
The station building is constructed near the platform for Demachiyanagi Station on the side toward Yodoyabashi Station, and is connected with the platform for Yodoyabashi by an underground passage.
The station building is constructed near the platform for Demachiyanagi Station on the side toward Yodoyabashi Station, and is connected with the platform for Yodoyabashi by an underground passage.

sen.j: 大阪方面ホームの東側には奈良線が並行して通っている。
sen.e: Along the east side of the platform for Osaka Station, the Nara Line is running parallelly.
The Nara Line runs in parallel along the east side of the platform for Osaka Station.
The Nara Line runs in parallel along the east side of the platform for Osaka Station.

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は7両。
sen.e: *The effective length of both platforms is 7 cars long.
*Each platform has an effective length of seven train cars.
* Each platform has an effective length of seven train cars.

sen.j: 番線表示はない。
sen.e: There is no indication of platform numbers.
The platforms aren't indicated by numbers.
The platforms aren't indicated by numbers.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 任天堂京都リサーチセンター（旧本社）
sen.e: Nintendo Kyoto R&D Center (former Head Quarters)
sen.cmt: 任天堂京都リサーチセンター→定訳不明 [http://www.screwattack.com/node/19713] を参照にNintendo R&D Centerとしました。
sen.e: Nintendo Kyoto R&D Center (formerly the headquarters)
Nintendo Kyoto R&D Center (formerly the headquarters)

sen.j: 東福寺
sen.e: Tofukuji Temple
Tofukuji Temple
Tofuku-ji Temple
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: 大羽記念病院→稲荷山病院
sen.e: Oba Memorial Hospital=>Inariyama Hospital
Oba Memorial Hospital=>Inariyama Hospital
Oba Memorial Hospital=>Inariyama Hospital

sen.j: 京都鳥羽道郵便局
sen.e: Kyoto-Tobamichi Post Office
The Kyoto-Tobamichi post office
The Kyoto-Tobamichi post office

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stops
Bus stops
Bus stops

sen.j: 京阪鳥羽街道駅には、バス路線は乗り入れていない。
sen.e: There is no bus connection at Keihan Tobakaido Station.
There is no bus connection at Keihan Tobakaido Station.
There is no bus connection at Keihan Tobakaido Station.

sen.j: 最寄バス停：京都市交通局十条相深町
sen.e: The nearest bus stop: Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau Jujo Aifukacho
sen.cmt: 京都市交通局→Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau [http://www.city.kyoto.jp/html/kotsu/]
sen.e: Nearest bus stop: Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau Jujo Aifukacho
Nearest bus stop: Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau Jujo Aifukacho

sen.j: 十条相深町
sen.e: Jujo Aifukacho: Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
Jujo Aifukacho: Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
Jujo Aifukacho
sen.cmt: 原文にないため、Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau 削除しました。

sen.j: バス停は駅前ではなく、駅から徒歩5分の師団街道沿いにある。
sen.e: The bus stop is not in front of the station but is situated along the Shidan-kaido Way, a 5-minute walk from the station.
sen.cmt: 師団街道→定訳不明 [Shidan-kaido Wayとしました]
sen.e: The bus stop isn't in front of the station but is situated along the Shidan-kaido Way, a five-minute walk from the station.
The bus stop isn't in front of the station but is situated along the Shidan-kaido Road, a five-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
sen.cmt: 京都市営バス→Kyoto City Bus [http://www.city.kyoto.jp/koho/eng/access/transport.html]
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 南5系統：（伏見稲荷大社経由）竹田駅 (京都府)東口行／京都駅行
sen.e: South Route 5: for Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) Higashiguchi (through Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine)/ for Kyoto Station
sen.cmt: 南5系統→定訳不明 [South Route 5としました]、伏見稲荷大社→Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine [http://inari.jp/]
sen.e: South Route 5: For Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) Higashiguchi (through Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine) and/or for Kyoto Station
South Route 5: For East Exit of Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (via Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine)/Kyoto Station

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 開業。
sen.e: April 15, 1910: The station opened.
April 15, 1910: The station opened.
April 15, 1910: The station opened.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: Because of the merger of the company, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (Hankyu Railway)
sen.cmt: 京阪神急行電鉄→定訳不明 [Keihanshin Express Railwayとしました]、阪急→Hankyu Railway [http://dentetsuhankyu.co.jp.company/gaiyo.html]
sen.e: October 1, 1943: The station became a facility of the Keihanshin Express Railway (Hankyu Railway) due to the merger of the company.
October 1, 1943: The station became a facility of the Keihanshin Express Railway (Hankyu Railway) due to the merger of the company.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）9月15日 輸送混乱防止のため休止。
sen.e: September 15, 1945: To prevent the confusions in transportation, its service was suspended.
September 15, 1945: To prevent confusion in transportation, the station's services were suspended.
September 15, 1945: To prevent confusion in transportation, the station's services were suspended.

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）5月11日 営業再開。
sen.e: May 11, 1946: The station service restarted.
May 11, 1946: The station commenced service again.
May 11, 1946: The station commenced service again.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Following the corporate spin-off, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 分離→spin-off [英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Following the corporate spin-off, it became a station of the Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Following the corporate spin-off, it became a station of the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1968年（昭和43年）7月21日 構内地下道使用開始、構内踏切を廃止。
sen.e: July 21, 1968: The underground passage in the yard started to be used, and the yard crossing was disused.
sen.cmt: 構内地下道→定訳不明：underground passage in the yard、構内踏切→yard crossing
sen.e: July 21, 1968: The underground passage in the yard started being used, and the yard crossing was abandoned.
July 21, 1968: The underground passage in the yard started being used, and the yard crossing was abandoned.

sen.j: 鳥羽・伏見の戦いで有名な鳥羽街道は当駅から2km以上西にある。
sen.e: Toba-kaido Way, which is famous for the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, is more than 2km away to the west from this station.
sen.cmt: 鳥羽街道、鳥羽・伏見の戦い→Battle of Toba-Fushimi [http://www.absoluteastronomy.com/topics/Battle_of_Toba-Fushimi]、鳥羽街道→Toba-kaido Way
sen.e: Toba-kaido Way, which is famous for the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, is more than two kilometers west of this station.
Toba-kaido Road, which is famous for the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, is more than two kilometers west of this station.

sen.j: にも拘らずこのような駅名が付けられたのは、1902年に当駅付近から鳥羽街道までの間を結ぶ新道（現在の十条通）が通じ、鳥羽街道に出ることが可能になったことから、その最寄り駅として命名されたためと考えられる。
sen.e: Even though, this station was named as such, because in 1902 a new road (current Jujo-dori) connecting the vicinity of the station with Toba-kaido Way was constructed, making the passing through to Toba-kaido Way possible, and it seems that the station was named after the fact that it is the nearest station to the Way.

However, this station was named as such because, in 1902, a new road (current Jujo-dori) connecting the vicinity of the station with Toba-kaido Way was constructed, making it possible to pass through to Toba-kaido Way, and it seems that the station was named after the fact that it was the nearest station to Toba-kaido Way.

However, this station was named as such because, in 1902, a new road (current Jujo-dori Street) connecting the vicinity of the station with Toba-kaido Road was constructed, making it possible to pass through to Toba-kaido Road, and it seems that the station was named after the fact that it was the nearest station to Toba-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: Way →Road としました。Jujo-dori Street としました。

sen.j: 東福寺へは当駅の方が東福寺駅よりも近い。
sen.e: To Tofukuji Temple this station is nearer than Tofukuji Station.
This station is nearer to Tofukuji Temple than Tofukuji Station is.
This station is nearer to Tofuku-ji Temple than Tofukuji Station is.
